text: Hi kids!
Guess who's here
Yes it's me bob..
Join me for learning street with bob..
Hello kids,
Today we are going to turn this empty room into a classroom with things we see in the classroom
That should be fun!
It is. So,Lets begin

If we do not have a CHAIR
We will be sitting on thin air

So we need a few chairs
Little straight red chairs.

Where do we keep our BOOK
How about a TABLE in that nook
A table made of wood will be really good.

Should the BOARD be green or black
Pick a color little Jack

You know what I mean 
Yes, the one that’s green.

To be able to write
We need DESKS, am I right?
Go with the red chair! Let’s see what will pair?

What goes on that side?
A CUPBOARD that is wide
Let it be big and airy And the color of cherry

What else do we need?
PENS and PENCILS indeed

How about a pen that’s blue
And a black pencil or two.

There will be many a mistake
That you kids will make

An ERASER that smells like candy
Will surely come in handy

Here are your SCHOOL BAGS
With your NAME TAGS

To carry your books and notes
And your little raincoats.

We need a nice big MAP
That will gently flap

Stick it tight so it won’t fall
On this creamy white wall.

How will you know the time
So here is something that will chime

Tick tock tick tock tick
Goes the big wall CLOCK

Where must you throw
All the waste, do you know?

Let’s get a green trash BIN
That looks like a big tin.

You know what else do we need
A place to keep books that we read

A few SHELVES by that wall
To store our stuff and all.
So, do you like your classroom now?
It’s awesome.

Great!
So, in a classroom, what are the things we see?
Chairs, desks, cupboards
Books, pens and pencils and yes, erasers
Maps, clocks and school bags
And boards and books and tables
Very good! So now let’s start our lessons for today in this lovely classroom.
Hope you kids are also having as much fun in your classrooms as we are!
We will be back with more songs and fun learning.
Till then, Adios
